gradedGroups.title: Problem 1A
gradedGroups.content:
Coach Kawa collected data on $5$ of his baseball players.  The points show shoe size and the number of runs scored this week by the $5$ players.  
 
![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/05cc5f7c0ed8685d9affe9e9e37c0e38f2631f82)

**Which player scored the most runs?**
[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: This player has the largest shoe size, not the most runs.

hint.content:
Runs are represented by the $y$-axis.  So, we need to find the point that represents the highest value (farthest up) on the $y$-axis.  

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/58c578144d200b34c66d9fdcbca88027e84e6cf2)


**$\purple{\text{Carmen}}$ scored the most runs.**

gradedGroups.title: Problem 1B
gradedGroups.content:
A group of $6$ friends collected data about their families.  The points show numbers of brothers and sisters of the $6$ friends.  
 
![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2d9cb6d4aa22e469e4a94c02b328eff9ec092c86)

**How many more sisters does Ana have than Takuya has?**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] sisters

answers.message: This is how many more *brothers* Ana has, not *sisters*.

hint.content:
The number of sisters is represented by the $y$-axis.  We need to know the $y$-coordinates for $\purpleC{\text{Takuya}}$ and $\greenD{\text{Ana}}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/9495426bfd16625047964d1926fc79fb58dc0b8e)

$\purpleC{\text{Takuya}}$ has $\purpleC{1}$ sister.  $\greenD{\text{Ana}}$ has $\greenD{3}$ sisters.

Let's subtract to see how many more sisters $\greenD{\text{Ana}}$  has than $\purpleC{\text{Takuya}}$ has.

$\purpleC{3} - \greenD{1} = \maroonD{2}$

**Ana has $\maroonD{2}$ more sisters than Takuya has.**

gradedGroups.title: Problem 1C
gradedGroups.content:
Mrs. Jacobs collected data about her students.  The points show age and number of baby teeth lost by $6$ of her students.
 
![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/6302f62c863bfc13face9bd80b71d87f10ad77d0)

**What is the total number of baby teeth lost?**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] baby teeth

answers.message: This is the sum of the ages, not the teeth.

hint.content:
Number of baby teeth lost are represented by the $y$-axis.  Let's make a table from the data.

Name | Number of baby teeth lost
:-| -:
Wanaton|$18$
Yui|$15$
Mustafa|$12$
Takoda|$9$
Ayumi|$8$
Devora|$7$

We can add to find the total.

$18 + 15 + 12 + 9 + 8 + 7 = 69$

**The students lost a total of $69$ baby teeth.**

gradedGroups.title: Problem 2A
gradedGroups.content:
Lyn graphed the locations of several places on her school playground on the coordinate plane shown below.  There is also a water fountain halfway between the slide and the rope climb.

**At what coordinates should Lyn graph the water fountain?**  

 $($[[☃ numeric-input 1]]$,\,$[[☃ numeric-input 2]]$)$

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/39df864fbe5702fe07d20269b8a0f49508fad39d)

hint.content:
The $\purpleC{\text{slide}}$ is $4$ units from the $\greenD{\text{rope climb}}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/bd6041eec9c6f9c6220e4de188aeb130fbbae531)

So, the $\goldD{\text{water fountain}}$ is ${4}\div{2} = 2$ units away from both the $\greenD{\text{rope climb}}$ and $\purpleC{\text{slide}}$.  

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/69b9de05421d8ce073b877b353858b7c67ae47ec)

**Lyn should graph the water fountain at coordinates $(4,7)$.**

gradedGroups.title: Problem 2B
gradedGroups.content:
Marc graphed the locations of several places in his school on the coordinate plane shown below. 

**Determine if each statement about Marc's graph is true or false.**

[[☃ categorizer 1]]


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/093ccf4144d9fdab99070e87d1478989714b61d7)

items: Art is closer to the library than to science.
Math is located $2$ units from the $y$-axis.

hint.content:
Art is $\greenD{4}$ units from the $\greenD{\text{library}}$ and $\purpleC5$ units from $\purpleC{\text{science}}$.


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/caa5c2fea5850bc5c627ea950c90c1e93189e557)

$\greenD4<\purpleC5$, so art is closer to the $\greenD{\text{library}}$ than $\purpleC{\text{science}}$.

$\goldD{\text{Math}}$ is located $7$ units from the $y$-axis, not $2$ units.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ee13326dfb15704705768c347e1cc03e895a5970)

$$ | True | False
- | - | -
Art is closer to the library than to science.| $\huge\bullet$ | $\huge\circ$
Math is located $2$ units from the $y$-axis. | $\huge\circ$ | $\huge\bullet$

gradedGroups.title: Problem 3A
gradedGroups.content:
For Halloween, Nana makes bags with orange and black candies for her  $5$ grandchildren.  The points show how many orange candies and how many black candies are in $4$ of the bags.  

The fifth bag has $4$ more orange candies than bag $1$ and $1$ less black candy than bag $2$.
 

**Plot the $5^{\text{th}}$ bag's candies on the coordinate plane below.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hint.content:
$\goldD{ \text{Bag 5}}$ has $\purpleC4$ more orange candies than bag $1$.  

Bag $1$ has $7$ orange candies.  So, $\goldD{\text{bag 5}}$ has $7+\purpleC4=\blueD{11}$ orange candies.  

The $x$-coordinate for $\goldD{\text{bag 5}}$ is $\blueD{11} $.


$\goldD{\text{Bag 5}}$ has $\tealD1$ less black candy than bag $2$.  

Bag $2$ has $13$ black candies.  So, $\goldD{\text{bag 5}}$ has $13-\tealD1=\greenD{12}$ black candies.  

The $y$-coordinate for $\goldD{\text{bag 5}}$ is $\greenD{12} $.


The coordinates for $\goldD{\text{bag 5}}$ are $(\blueD{11}, \greenD{12})$. 

Now, let's graph $(\blueD{11}, \greenD{12})$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a512bb5813a05eea175afc54fe1cbdd2147b12e9)

gradedGroups.title: Problem 3B
gradedGroups.content:
Abigail is recording information about her pets on a coordinate plane.  Each ordered pair shows the age (in years) and the mass (in kilograms), respectively, of one of her pets.

Ginger: $(3,4)$  
Daisy: $(2,20)$  
Buddy: $(7,8)$  

Abigail also has a dog named Snuggles that is $1$ year younger than Buddy and has $4$ times Buddy's mass.

**What ordered pair represents Snuggles's age and mass?**

 $($[[☃ numeric-input 1]]$,\,$[[☃ numeric-input 2]]$)$

hint.content:
Buddy's ordered pair is $(\greenD{7},\purpleC{8})$.  This means that Buddy is $\greenD{7}$ years old and has a mass of $\purpleC{8}$ kilograms. 

Snuggles is $\blueD{1}$ year younger than Buddy.

$\greenD{7} - \blueD{1} = \maroonD{6}$

Snuggles is $\maroonD{6}$ years old.

Snuggles has $\redC{4}$ times the mass of Buddy.

$\redC{4} \times \purpleC{8} = \goldE{32}$

Snuggles has a mass of $\goldE{32}$ kilograms.

**The ordered pair $(\maroonD{6}, \goldE{32})$ represents Snuggles's age and mass.**
